rules.natural: Patron1 has access to the restricted section or authorization is granted to patron1.
Provided that journal1 is checked out, journal1 is available.
Under the condition that journal1 is on hold, if it is missing, then it is not damaged.
If journal1 is requested, then either it is checked out or it is on hold.
Journal1 is requested or journal1 is reserved.
Should journal1 be reserved, then it is either checked out or on hold.
Whenever delivery_truck1 is registered, authorization is granted to patron1.
If delivery_truck1 is authorized, then it is registered.
Provided that delivery_truck1 is verified, it is registered.
If patron1 has clearance at level1, then patron1 does not have access to the restricted section.
Under the condition that driver1 is licensed, delivery_truck1 is authorized.
Should driver1 be certified, then delivery_truck1 is verified.
If delivery_truck1 is scheduled for delivery, then either driver1 is licensed or driver1 is certified.
Librarian1 is verified or librarian1 is authenticated.
Provided that librarian1 is authenticated, authorization is granted to patron1.
If access is granted to patron1 for the archive room, then access is denied to patron1 for the archive room.
Under the condition that access is granted to patron1 for the archive room, it is not the case that access is denied to patron1 for the archive room.
Access is granted to patron1 for the archive room or security_system1 does not trigger a system alert.
If patron1 has clearance at level2, then patron1 does not have access to the restricted section.

Should security_head1 be notified, then if it is not the case that whenever journal1 is missing, it is not damaged leads to an investigation being launched for journal1, then the investigation is completed for journal1.
Either security_head1 is notified or security_head1 acknowledges the notification.

If security_head1 acknowledges the notification, then given that not (journal1 is missing implies it is not damaged) results in an investigation launched for journal1, the investigation is completed for journal1.
Under the condition that patron1 is verified via biometrics, patron1's fingerprint is matched.
Provided that patron1 is verified via biometrics, it is not the case that patron1's fingerprint is matched.
If the alarm is silenced in security_system1, then security_system1 does not trigger a system alert.
The alarm is silenced in security_system1 or the alarm is disabled in security_system1.
Should security_system1 be operational, then if the alarm is disabled, security_system1 does not trigger a system alert.
If security_system1 is monitored, then it is operational.
Under the condition that security_system1 is bypassed, it is not under maintenance.
Provided that patron1 is approved by security, then patron1 holds a valid ID or not having clearance at level1 or level2 leads to patron1 requiring an escort.
Under the condition that patron1 does not have clearance at level1 or level2, patron1 does not require an escort.
If it is not true that librarian1 being verified implies authorization is granted to patron1, then security_system1 triggers a system alert.
Provided that security_system1 being active does not imply it is monitored, then security_system1 is under maintenance.
If patron1 being approved by a librarian does not lead to patron1 being approved by security, then a manual override is applied for patron1.
If not (journal1 missing implies it is not damaged) leading to an investigation launched for journal1 is false, then the investigation is not completed for journal1.
Provided that authorization not being granted to patron1 implying emergency access for patron1 is false, then journal1 is damaged.
Under the condition that authorization not being granted to patron1 implying emergency access for patron1 does not hold, journal1 is missing.
If it is not true that lack of authorization for patron1 leads to emergency access for patron1, then patron1 is verified via biometrics.
If authorization is not granted to patron1, then patron1 does not have emergency access.

facts.natural: Patron1 is approved by a librarian.
An investigation is not launched for journal1.
Patron1 does not hold a valid ID.
A manual override is not applied for patron1.

steps.natural: Whenever patron1 is approved by a librarian, patron1 is approved by security.
If patron1 is approved by a librarian, then either patron1 holds a valid ID or lacking clearance at level1 or level2 implies patron1 requires an escort.
Patron1 holds a valid ID or if patron1 does not have clearance at level1 or level2, then patron1 requires an escort.
Should patron1 not have clearance at level1 or level2, then patron1 requires an escort.
Either patron1 has clearance at level1 or patron1 has clearance at level2.

Authorization is granted to patron1.

Journal1 is available, or if journal1 is missing, then it is not damaged.
Whenever journal1 is missing, it is not the case that journal1 is damaged.

Whenever authorization is not granted to patron1, patron1 has emergency access.
Authorization is granted to patron1.

Delivery_truck1 is registered.
Authorization is granted to patron1.

Security_system1 does not trigger a system alert.

If it is not the case that journal1 being missing implies it is not damaged, then an investigation is launched for journal1.
Whenever journal1 is missing, it is not the case that journal1 is damaged.
Should authorization not being granted to patron1 implying emergency access for patron1 be negated, then journal1 is not damaged.
Whenever authorization is not granted to patron1, patron1 has emergency access.
Authorization is granted to patron1.
Patron1 is not verified via biometrics.
Whenever authorization is not granted to patron1, patron1 has emergency access.
Authorization is granted to patron1.
Security_system1 is not under maintenance.
Provided that security_system1 is active, it is monitored.
Security_system1 is monitored.
Security_system1 is operational.
Whenever the alarm is disabled in security_system1, security_system1 does not trigger a system alert.
Security_system1 does not trigger a system alert.
Whenever librarian1 is verified, authorization is granted to patron1.
Authorization is granted to patron1.

(A1 ∨ G).natural: Patron1 has access to the restricted section or authorization is granted to patron1.

(A11 → ¬A10).natural: Whenever journal1 is missing, it is not the case that journal1 is damaged.

(A12 ∨ (A11 → ¬A10)).natural: Journal1 is available, or if journal1 is missing, then it is not damaged.

(A13 → A12).natural: Provided that journal1 is checked out, journal1 is available.

(A13 ∨ A14).natural: Either journal1 is checked out or journal1 is on hold.

(A14 → (A11 → ¬A10)).natural: Under the condition that journal1 is on hold, if it is missing, then it is not damaged.

(A15 → (A13 ∨ A14)).natural: If journal1 is requested, then either it is checked out or it is on hold.

(A15 ∨ A16).natural: Journal1 is requested or journal1 is reserved.

(A16 → (A13 ∨ A14)).natural: Should journal1 be reserved, then it is either checked out or on hold.

(A17 → G).natural: Whenever delivery_truck1 is registered, authorization is granted to patron1.

(A18 → A17).natural: If delivery_truck1 is authorized, then it is registered.

(A18 ∨ A19).natural: Delivery_truck1 is authorized or delivery_truck1 is verified.

(A19 → A17).natural: Provided that delivery_truck1 is verified, it is registered.

(A2 → ¬A1).natural: If patron1 has clearance at level1, then patron1 does not have access to the restricted section.

(A2 ∨ A3).natural: Either patron1 has clearance at level1 or patron1 has clearance at level2.

(A20 → A18).natural: Under the condition that driver1 is licensed, delivery_truck1 is authorized.

(A20 ∨ A21).natural: Driver1 is licensed or driver1 is certified.

(A21 → A19).natural: Should driver1 be certified, then delivery_truck1 is verified.

(A22 → (A20 ∨ A21)).natural: If delivery_truck1 is scheduled for delivery, then either driver1 is licensed or driver1 is certified.

(A23 → G).natural: Whenever librarian1 is verified, authorization is granted to patron1.

(A23 ∨ A24).natural: Librarian1 is verified or librarian1 is authenticated.

(A24 → G).natural: Provided that librarian1 is authenticated, authorization is granted to patron1.

(A26 → A27).natural: If access is granted to patron1 for the archive room, then access is denied to patron1 for the archive room.

(A26 → ¬A27).natural: Under the condition that access is granted to patron1 for the archive room, it is not the case that access is denied to patron1 for the archive room.

(A26 ∨ ¬A25).natural: Access is granted to patron1 for the archive room or security_system1 does not trigger a system alert.

(A3 → ¬A1).natural: If patron1 has clearance at level2, then patron1 does not have access to the restricted section.

(A30 → (¬(¬(A11 → ¬A10) → A28) → A29)).natural: Should security_head1 be notified, then if it is not the case that whenever journal1 is missing, it is not damaged leads to an investigation being launched for journal1, then the investigation is completed for journal1.

(A30 ∨ A31).natural: Either security_head1 is notified or security_head1 acknowledges the notification.

(A31 → (¬(¬(A11 → ¬A10) → A28) → A29)).natural: If security_head1 acknowledges the notification, then given that not (journal1 is missing implies it is not damaged) results in an investigation launched for journal1, the investigation is completed for journal1.

(A32 → A33).natural: Under the condition that patron1 is verified via biometrics, patron1's fingerprint is matched.

(A32 → ¬A33).natural: Provided that patron1 is verified via biometrics, it is not the case that patron1's fingerprint is matched.

(A34 → ¬A25).natural: If the alarm is silenced in security_system1, then security_system1 does not trigger a system alert.

(A34 ∨ A35).natural: The alarm is silenced in security_system1 or the alarm is disabled in security_system1.

(A35 → ¬A25).natural: Whenever the alarm is disabled in security_system1, security_system1 does not trigger a system alert.

(A36 → (A35 → ¬A25)).natural: Should security_system1 be operational, then if the alarm is disabled, security_system1 does not trigger a system alert.

(A37 → A36).natural: If security_system1 is monitored, then it is operational.

(A38 → A37).natural: Provided that security_system1 is active, it is monitored.

(A40 → ¬A39).natural: Under the condition that security_system1 is bypassed, it is not under maintenance.

(A5 ∨ (¬(A2 ∨ A3) → A4)).natural: Patron1 holds a valid ID or if patron1 does not have clearance at level1 or level2, then patron1 requires an escort.

(A6 → (A5 ∨ (¬(A2 ∨ A3) → A4))).natural: If patron1 is approved by a librarian, then either patron1 holds a valid ID or lacking clearance at level1 or level2 implies patron1 requires an escort.

(A6 → A7).natural: Whenever patron1 is approved by a librarian, patron1 is approved by security.

(A7 → (A5 ∨ (¬(A2 ∨ A3) → A4))).natural: Provided that patron1 is approved by security, then patron1 holds a valid ID or not having clearance at level1 or level2 leads to patron1 requiring an escort.

(¬(A11 → ¬A10) → A28).natural: If it is not the case that journal1 being missing implies it is not damaged, then an investigation is launched for journal1.

(¬(A2 ∨ A3) → A4).natural: Should patron1 not have clearance at level1 or level2, then patron1 requires an escort.

(¬(A2 ∨ A3) → ¬A4).natural: Under the condition that patron1 does not have clearance at level1 or level2, patron1 does not require an escort.

(¬(A23 → G) → A25).natural: If it is not true that librarian1 being verified implies authorization is granted to patron1, then security_system1 triggers a system alert.

(¬(A38 → A37) → A39).natural: Provided that security_system1 being active does not imply it is monitored, then security_system1 is under maintenance.

(¬(A6 → A7) → A8).natural: If patron1 being approved by a librarian does not lead to patron1 being approved by security, then a manual override is applied for patron1.

(¬(¬(A11 → ¬A10) → A28) → A29).natural: Should it not be the case that not (journal1 missing implies it is not damaged) results in an investigation launched for journal1, then the investigation is completed for journal1.

(¬(¬(A11 → ¬A10) → A28) → ¬A29).natural: If not (journal1 missing implies it is not damaged) leading to an investigation launched for journal1 is false, then the investigation is not completed for journal1.

(¬(¬G → A9) → A10).natural: Provided that authorization not being granted to patron1 implying emergency access for patron1 is false, then journal1 is damaged.

(¬(¬G → A9) → A11).natural: Under the condition that authorization not being granted to patron1 implying emergency access for patron1 does not hold, journal1 is missing.

(¬(¬G → A9) → A32).natural: If it is not true that lack of authorization for patron1 leads to emergency access for patron1, then patron1 is verified via biometrics.

(¬(¬G → A9) → ¬A10).natural: Should authorization not being granted to patron1 implying emergency access for patron1 be negated, then journal1 is not damaged.

(¬G → A9).natural: Whenever authorization is not granted to patron1, patron1 has emergency access.

(¬G → ¬A9).natural: If authorization is not granted to patron1, then patron1 does not have emergency access.

A6.natural: Patron1 is approved by a librarian.

¬A1.natural: It is not the case that patron1 has access to the restricted section.

¬A25.natural: Security_system1 does not trigger a system alert.

¬A26.natural: Access is not granted to patron1 for the archive room.

¬A28.natural: An investigation is not launched for journal1.

¬A32.natural: Patron1 is not verified via biometrics.

¬A5.natural: Patron1 does not hold a valid ID.

¬A8.natural: A manual override is not applied for patron1.
